content.description: This problem is a fun warm up on positive holds the whole way up the leaning arête. SDS and move up on good slopers and pockets. Cross through and go for the nice holds on the lip. Throw up for the last good hold and pull up.
content.protection: crash pad and maybe a spotter kind of a drop.

content.description: Starts low low in the overhang. Look for small pebbles to purchase your foot on. Starts on the obvious hold with your right and a hidden under long feature with your left. Pull up adjust your feet over into the corner. Throw your right hand to the sloper pocket and hope it sticks. Getting here can be a crux in itself lots of compression either way you choose. Make sure to take a breath before firing through the torquey crux transitioning from the overhang out to the arête. If compared to surrounding problems this starts like flesh wound and ends like pipe streamed at Baldy. Great problem.
content.location: Problem starts low in the overhang

content.description: The Leaning Corner boulder is a beautiful boulder up from the first set of boulders you encounter. Hike eastward for 2-3 minutes you should come to some huge highballs on your right and right in front of you shinning in all its contrived glory is The Leaning Corner boulder. 2 Known problems exist on this block and should not be missed. One great warm up and one harder more contrived problem.
